intro: Achyropsis laniceps, commonly known as the woolly achyropsis, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, with its thick leaves storing water and reducing transpiration. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, and its growth habit is typically low and mat-forming. Due to its unique adaptations, Achyropsis laniceps is an important component of the local flora in its native habitat.
